intro: Chouxia bijugata, commonly known as the two-lobed bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. Its root system consists of fibrous roots, and it thrives in well-drained soils. Chouxia bijugata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional Chinese medicine.
